pathr 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

pathr

The goal of pathr is to simplify the process of string manipulations for URLs and file paths. This uses modified functions from the {httr} to create opinionated functions that allow working with URLs and paths easier.

Installation

You can install the development version of pathr like so:

devtools::install_github("koderkow/pathr")

URLs

Basic URLs 

library(pathr)

Sort components of a URL

url <- "https://github.com/KoderKow/pathr"

x <- parse_url(url)

x
#> Url: https://github.com/KoderKow/pathr
#> - scheme: https
#> - hostname: github.com
#> - path: KoderKow/pathr

str(x)
#> List of 10
#>  $ scheme  : chr "https"
#>  $ hostname: chr "github.com"
#>  $ port    : NULL
#>  $ path    : chr "KoderKow/pathr"
#>  $ file    :List of 3
#>   ..$ dir : NULL
#>   ..$ file: NULL
#>   ..$ ext : NULL
#>  $ query   : NULL
#>  $ params  : NULL
#>  $ fragment: NULL
#>  $ username: NULL
#>  $ password: NULL
#>  - attr(*, "class")= chr [1:2] "pathr" "character"

Put it back to together

build_url(x)
#> [1] "https://github.com/KoderKow/pathr"

URLs with a file path

URLs with item paths will be detected

url <- "https://github.com/KoderKow/pathr/example-folder/my-data.csv"

x <- parse_url(url)

x
#> Url: https://github.com/KoderKow/pathr/example-folder/my-data.csv
#> - scheme: https
#> - hostname: github.com
#> - path: KoderKow/pathr/example-folder/my-data.csv
#> - file_dir: KoderKow/pathr/example-folder
#> - file_file: my-data
#> - file_ext: csv

str(x)
#> List of 10
#>  $ scheme  : chr "https"
#>  $ hostname: chr "github.com"
#>  $ port    : NULL
#>  $ path    : chr "KoderKow/pathr/example-folder/my-data.csv"
#>  $ file    :List of 3
#>   ..$ dir : chr "KoderKow/pathr/example-folder"
#>   ..$ file: chr "my-data"
#>   ..$ ext : chr "csv"
#>  $ query   : NULL
#>  $ params  : NULL
#>  $ fragment: NULL
#>  $ username: NULL
#>  $ password: NULL
#>  - attr(*, "class")= chr [1:2] "pathr" "character"

Building the URL ignores the file element

build_url(x)
#> [1] "https://github.com/KoderKow/pathr/example-folder/my-data.csv"

Thanks to

  • {httr} package for the code for parse_url() and build_url()
